result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle S. Ewert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System - IMPOSED AND STAYED.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample if not already recorded/submitted.  Court does assess the DNA surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

supervisions.notes: Costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as condition of probation in Count 1.

in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer. Defendant is entitled to 128 days presentence credit.  TIME SERVED.
Consecutive to:

3:59 - Defendant Kyle S. Ewert in court, in custody with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews chg and pen and questions def.  Guilty plea entered to counts 1 & 2 W/O REPEATER;  court accepts plea and finds def. guilty to count 1 & count 2.  Counts 3 & 4 are DRI.  Sentencing recomendation by the state.  Sentencing recomendation by Attorney Buckett.  Def. makes statement.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

Count 1 -
42 mos prison
18 mos IC
24 mos ES
cons. to any other sentence
Imposed & Stayed for 30 mos. probation
Not eligible for CIP or SAP
Pay court costs and provide a DNA sample
AODA
Maintain absolute sobriety
Not possess/consume alcoholic beverages or set foot in any establishment whose primary business invloves alcohol
Not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription
Not use or possess drug paraphernalia
Must report to probation by 4:00 p.m. tomorrow

Count 2 - 
170 days DCJ
128 days credit
